quote: Fiction is the truth inside the lie.
author: Stephen King

quote: The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense.
author: Tom Clancy

quote: If it's fiction, then it better be true.
author: Sherman Alexie,  The Toughest Indian in the World

quote: Fiction reveals truths that reality obscures.
author: Jessamyne West

quote: In the end, fiction is the craft of telling truth through lies.
author: Lauren Groff

quote: Fiction is about everything human and we are made out of dust, and if you scorn getting yourself dusty, then you shouldn't try to write fiction. It's not a grand enough job for you.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Fiction is art and art is the triumph over chaos… to celebrate a world that lies spread out around us like a bewildering and stupendous dream.
author: John Cheever

quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Writing fiction is the act of weaving a series of lies to arrive at a greater truth.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: Beyond the fiction of reality, there is the reality of the fiction.
author: Slavoj Žižek,  Less Than Nothing: Hegel and the Shadow of Dialectical Materialism

quote: Good fiction creates its own reality.
author: Nora Roberts,  The Stanislaski Brothers: Mikhail and Alex

quote: Fiction is a solution, the best solution, to the problem of existential solitude.
author: Jonathan Franzen,  The Corrections

quote: Fiction is like a spider's web, attached ever so slightly perhaps, but still attached to life at all four corners. Often the attachment is scarcely perceptible.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Fiction just makes it all more interesting. Truth is so boring.
author: Charlaine Harris,  Dead as a Doornail

quote: Just because it's fiction doesn't mean it's any less true.
author: Jodi Picoult,  Between the Lines

quote: Non-fiction can distort; facts can be realigned. But fiction never lies.
author: V.S. Naipaul,  A Bend in the River

quote: Fiction should be a place of lollipops and escape. Real life is depressing enough--I, for one, don't want to read about make believe misery, too.
author: Nicole Christie,  Falling for the Ghost of You

quote: Fiction that adds up, that suggests a "logical consistency,"or an explanation of some kind, is surely second-rate fiction; for the truth of life is its mystery.
author: Joyce Carol Oates,  The Journal of Joyce Carol Oates: 1973-1982

quote: Fiction is like a spider's web, attached ever so lightly perhaps, but still attached to life at all four corners.
author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own

quote: Life is always going to be stranger than fiction, because fiction has to be convincing, and life doesn't.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Writing a novel is a terrible experience, during which the hair often falls out and the teeth decay. I'm always irritated by people who imply that writing fiction is an escape from reality. It is a plunge into reality and it's very shocking to the system.
author: Flannery O'Connor,  Mystery and Manners: Occasional Prose

quote: The trouble with writing fiction is that it has to make sense, whereas real life doesn't.
author: Iain M. Banks

quote: The urge to create a fictional narrative is a mysterious one, and when an idea comes, the writer's sense of what a story wants to be is only vaguely visible through the penumbra of inspiration.
author: Adam Johnson

quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction.
author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own

quote: Do not, under any circumstances, belittle a work of fiction by trying to turn it into a carbon copy of real life; what we search for in fiction is not so much reality but the epiphany of truth.
author: Azar Nafisi,  Reading Lolita in Tehran

quote: The reason that fiction is more interesting than any other form of literature, to those who really like to study people, is that in fiction the author can really tell the truth without humiliating himself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: There is only one genre in fiction, the genre is called book.
author: Matt Haig,  The Humans

quote: Science is my territory, but science fiction is the landscape of my dreams.
author: Freeman Dyson,  Imagined Worlds

quote: There is no doubt fiction makes a better job of the truth.
author: Doris Lessing,  Under My Skin: Volume One of My Autobiography, to 1949

quote: I have always held the old-fashioned opinion that the primary object of work of fiction should be to tell a story.
author: Wilkie Collins,  The Woman in White

quote: A lie, sometimes, can be truer than the truth, which is why fiction gets written.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: The trouble with fiction,"said John Rivers, "is that it makes too much sense. Reality never makes sense.
author: Aldous Huxley,  The Genius And The Goddess

quote: Science Fiction: Any scientific acclaim that omits God.
author: Johnny Hart

quote: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.
author: Mark Twain,  Following the Equator: A Journey Around the World

quote: I have found, in short, from reading my own writing, that my subject in fiction is the action of grace in territory largely held by the devil.I have also found that what I write is read by an audience which puts little stock either in grace or the devil. You discover your audience at the same time and in the same way that you discover your subject, but it is an added blow.
author: Flannery O'Connor,  Mystery and Manners: Occasional Prose

quote: There are people who think that things that happen in fiction do not really happen. These people are wrong.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Some major writers have a huge impact, like Ayn Rand, who to my mind is a lousy fiction writer because her writing has no compassion and virtually no humor. She has a philosophical and economical message that she is passing off as fiction, but it really isn't fiction at all.
author: Theodore Sturgeon

quote: If you will practice being fictional for a while, you will understand that fictional characters are sometimes more real than people with bodies and heartbeats.
author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah

quote: It is not a single cowardice that drives us into fiction's fantasies. We often fear that literature is a game we can't afford to play — the product of idleness and immoral ease. In the grip of that feeling it isn't life we pursue, but the point and purpose of life — its facility, its use.
author: William H. Gass,  Fiction and the Figures of Life

quote: A good piece of fiction, in my view, does not offer solutions. Good stories deal with our moral struggles, our uncertainties, our dreams, our blunders, our contradictions, our endless quest for understanding. Good stories do not resolve the mysteries of the human spirit but rather describe and expand up on those mysteries.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: Life is painful and disappointing. It is useless, therefore, to write new realistic novels. We generally know where we stand in relation to reality and don’t care to know any more.
author: Michel Houellebecq,  H.P. Lovecraft: Against the World, Against Life

quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: Books are like truth serum-- if you don't read, you can't figure out what's real.
author: Rodman Philbrick,  Freak the Mighty

quote: Don't classify me, read me. I'm a writer, not a genre.
author: Carlos Fuentes

quote: Science fiction is any idea that occurs in the head and doesn't exist yet, but soon will, and will change everything for everybody, and nothing will ever be the same again. As soon as you have an idea that changes some small part of the world you are writing science fiction. It is always the art of the possible, never the impossible.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: The best fiction is far more true than any journalism.
author: William Faulkner

quote: The worst part of writing fiction is the fear of wasting your life behind a keyboard. The idea that, dying, you'll realize you only lived on paper. Your only adventures were make-believe, and while the world fought and kissed, you sat in some dark room masturbating and making money.
author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Stranger than Fiction

quote: It's in literature that true life can be found. It's under the mask of fiction that you can tell the truth.
author: Gao Xingjian
